title: Aligning warp field output to ANTs SyN registration
body:
# **Task** (what are you trying to do/register?)

Warp field from voxelmorph is in IJK coordinate instead of XYZ. This maybe ambiguous when performing image transform in other software like Slicer 3D/ITK. 

Also the warp field is stored as 4D image instead of 3D vector image. SimpleITK only accepts vector pixels for displacement field transformation.

# **What have you tried**

I am much familiar with SimpleITK while VXM using nibabel as the backend. I use the following code to convert the voxelmorph warp field to the one comparable with ANTs SyN output.

``` python
# convert voxelmorph field to vector image
warp_np = sitk.GetArrayFromImage(warp).astype(np.float64)
warp_ = sitk.GetImageFromArray(np.moveaxis(warp_np,0,-1), isVector=True)
warp_.SetOrigin(warp.GetOrigin())
new_dir = [warp.GetDirection()[int(4*np.floor(i/3)+i%3)] for i in range(9)]
warp_.SetDirection(new_dir)
warp_.SetSpacing(moving.GetSpacing())
warp = warp_

# note that transformation field is in direction of NIFTI coordinate (RAS), ITK coordinate system use RAI direction by default. Here for coding convenience we use ITK system.
# please note that voxelmorph export warp field in ijk coordinate, need to rescale back to real space
# warp field from moving to fixed space should be scaling of spacing then translate by difference in image origin
scaling = [warp.GetSpacing()[i] for i in range(warp.GetNumberOfComponentsPerPixel())]
warp_ = sitk.Compose([sitk.VectorIndexSelectionCast(warp,i)*scaling[i] + (moving.GetOrigin()[i]-fixed.GetOrigin()[i]) for i in range(warp.GetNumberOfComponentsPerPixel())])
```

Not sure if the voxelmorph should change the warp field output to XYZ coordinate (or add an option for this). Image directions may also need to consider during the conversion.
